column2: MA DMV PERMIT TEST
column6: MA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column6: One way
column8: Sharp right turn ahead

column2: 2. This sign means:
column6: Stay on the main highway if possible
column8: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 3. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column6: share the lane with another vehicle.
column8: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 4. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column6: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column8: for yeild signs.

column2: 5. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column6: After the crosswalk.
column8: On the crosswalk.

column2: 6. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.

column2: 7. This road sign tells drivers that:
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 8. Regulation signs normally are:
column6: green rectangles.
column8: white triangles.

column2: 9. When you see this sign you should:
column4: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column6: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 10. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Rely on your mirrors.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 11. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column6: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column8: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.

column2: 12. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column6: distance yourself from the situation.
column8: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 13. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column8: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.

column2: 14. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: slow down before entering the curve.
column6: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column8: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.

column2: 15. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: Only right turns are allowed.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 16. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.

column2: 17. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column6: no sharp turn
column8: no U-turn

column2: 18. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column6: low beam headlights.
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 19. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column6: dangerous intersections.
column8: no passing zones.

column2: 20. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: pass the car on the left.
column10: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn permitted on red light
column6: No right turn permitted
column8: No U-turns

column2: 22. Green and white signs:
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column10: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 23. When changing lanes, you should:
column6: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
column8: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column10: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.

column2: 24. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column6: To halt the traffic flow.
column8: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column10: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 25. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column6: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column8: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column10: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
